storyInfo: To give the story an ending, the writer begins to tell the third story: Brigid makes a bet with the Exiled King, Loughshinny confronts the dark mist, and Nemos announces the death of the Red Dragon.

attributes.text: There was a mother who once ruled a kingdom until her crown and her family were taken by her foes.

The mother had a powerful daughter, who then made a pact with the dark mist in the dark woods to drive out their foes. The daughter reclaimed the kingdom for her mother, returning the promised peace to the dark mist.
The mother was to host a grand coronation for her daughter, but the daughter died mysteriously right before the event.
Tremendous woe and then rage engulfed the mother. Her zeal to avenge her daughter was so fierce that the entire kingdom was scorched by her vengeful fire.
Until that fury disturbed the dark mist, who had just returned to its resting peace.

The dark mist demanded that the mother cease, or she would be dragged into the darkness. But in her grief, the mother remained convinced that the dark mist was the one who had taken her daughter. A desperate battle was then inevitable. The mother determined to risk her life.

attributes.content: Nemos, Reed...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: At the city gates, the nomad looks back at the citadel in the distance one last time.
She resists the urge to turn tail and flee at the acrid burning smell. She knows what it signifies.
She knows she should do as Nemos said, and leave the city to seek the wakemen as quickly as possible, regardless of whether Loughshinny is successful.
But despite the urgency in Nemos's voice, she did not sound like she believed things would take a turn for the better, nor did she believe that Brigid could convince the wakemen to come.
Brigid could smell the same burning smell coming from Nemos. It reminded her of the obsessions that only the dead could have.
Who are you waiting for? Death? Are you just waiting for it to pat you on the back so you can have a nice little race together?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: ...Who is that?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Oh. I forgot you could hear me.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: I can hear you. I can even sense your presence... but I can't see you.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Leave the city, outsider.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: You're an outsider too, by the sound of it.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Naturally. Consider it advice from one outsider to another.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Live, Brigid. Nothing is more important than being alive. This city will be dead by sunrise tomorrow.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Listen to Nemos. Find her kinsmen, run as far as you can, and never look back.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: ...You're right. I should go.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: But I will be back.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Back?!
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Hah! Stubbornness and stupidity really are hereditary!
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: You're going to come back after she tried so hard to get you out of here?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: So you also think it was just an excuse to keep me safe?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: What else could it be? You really think you can sway those wood-brains? Maybe if you waited for spring, one of their brains would sprout and they might come with you to the Dark Woods!
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: I don't like the way you talk, invisible brother.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: What did you call me? Brother?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: You have burnt stench, but other than that, you remind me of the nomads. No clue how you're related to us, but it feels right.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Haha... hahahahaha!
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Let's make a bet then, Brigid.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: A bet?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: On whether you'll be back tonight, before Na Saoirsí is burned to the ground. I say it's impossible.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: That's not what you really want to bet on.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Oh yeah? Then tell me, what I'm really thinking?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: You just want to prove that you're right, that nothing is more important than being alive. You think I'll choose survival in the end.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: But whatever. You're on.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Well, what are you waiting for then?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: It just doesn't feel fair. If you win, I'll live the rest of my life in regret. But if I win, it doesn't really matter to a bystander like you.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: So how about this? If I win, you go back to where you came from.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: And where do you think I should go back to?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: No idea, but not here. This isn't your home.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: You sound like you've been betrayed by the cityfolk here before, but you still can't bring yourself to hurt them.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: You act like you want to see them reap what they sowed, but didn't sound happy at all when you talked about the city burning to the ground.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Honestly, you're the most struggling person I ever met, and—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Enough!
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Very well. If you win, I'll return to where I belong.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: But just coming back here to die won't cut it.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: What else do you need me to do then?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Deliver a message to those wood-brains outside the city. Tell them...
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: (Ancient Tengae) 'It's been six hundred years. Nobody's blaming you anymore. Go do your jobs.'
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Oh, and one more thing. (Ancient Tengae) 'I *Ancient Tengae expletive* you stupid wood-brains!'
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Uh... What?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Pass that on to those fools verbatim, especially the filthier bits. Did you get all that? Need me to repeat myself?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: N-No, the elders sometimes speak that language, so I understand it, more or less...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Then go.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: What are you waiting for?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Was all of that just so you could tell me this?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: ...Just get moving already!
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: The golden-haired nomad takes a deep breath and runs away from the city.
Her ancestor whose figure she never saw stands in place, unmoving.
That stubbornness and stupidity...
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: ...really are hereditary.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Nemos turns to leave, while Loughshinny looks towards the Dark Woods.
The sun has set beneath the horizon. Curfew is about to begin.
In the distance, she sees the dark mist spreading from the forest towards Na Saoirsí, thicker than ever.
*pant*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Made it in time...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: She raises her spear toward the mist outside, lighting a bright yellow spark in the city of purple.
As though receiving some kind of message, the mist slowly rises until it is level with the flame at the tip of her spear.
Yes, come here, where it's warm and bright, where there's still life... yes, over here.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What? You want to pretend I don't exist again?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I won't let you.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: This light will never go out, not until true darkness falls.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Attracted by the flame in her hand, yet unable to approach, the mist begins to flow through the streets.
Soon, it returns. But this time, her flame can neither draw or repel it.
There is a cacophony within the mist. She feels as though everything has gone dark all of a sudden—
The dark mist has come.
Yes, this is my answer.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: It is incomplete. It needs time.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.text: Time is your enemy, not your friend.

attributes.content: We'll see about that.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The deathly fires have not yet completely transformed the people into the walking dead. They're still alive. There is still time to return the flames.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: And you're not going anywhere until Nemos awakens them.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Ridiculous? Maybe.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Maybe my strength, my wisdom, and my Arts are all so insignificant to you that it seems ridiculous.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: But I have my resolve.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Nemos drags the coffin through the corridor.
The red dragon's remains do not burn. They simply lie there quietly.
This is how death should be. But Nemos seems to hear an ethereal voice laughing in her ear.
Without hesitation, the wayward wakewoman lifts the limp body and tosses it into the coffin.
This coffin, red dragon, is your final resting place...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: It's where those like you belong.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: So where are you now? Are you still watching us from somewhere, with that twisted smile of yours?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: But this vessel, at least, is beyond your reach. Otherwise, you'd have burned me to ash by now.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: And this spear, which never left your side... How many times have you breathed your flames from it, and how many others like Culann have been your victims?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: You don't even know the answer, do you?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: With great effort, Nemos lifts the spear and thrusts it into the coffin.
Flames from its tip engulf the coffin in an instant, spreading along the rope connecting it to Nemos and merging with the purple fire on her.
A deathly cold runs through Nemos's body, but she could hardly feel temperature at this point.
You're mine now.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I'll finish what Culann started.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Let's go, to those lowly, despicable places that suffered from the war you stole victory in.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: You will be seen by all. Your death will be seen by all.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: They will know that you are dead. That the proud, imperious red dragon is dead. 'Here lies Eblana Dublinn, in this coffin covered in freezing flames.'
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: But... what will they do then?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I pray that your death will wake them up, of course, as Loughshinny hoped.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: That they'll know that the era you represented is over. That Na Saoirsí will escape this calamity. That Tara need not celebrate its rebirth with the death of a city.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: But... heh...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Your fire must have gotten to my head, dragon.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Why is that I suddenly feel like the other ending... where it all ends in destruction... isn't so bad?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Someone else may have killed you, but...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: This is my revenge.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: The coffin remains silent, and Nemos no longer speaks.
Silent, delirious, and determined, she drags the burning coffin down the stairs, making a point to let it hit each step on the way down.
It sounds like the withered mockery of the dead.
